intro: Comarostaphylis arguta, commonly known as the roughleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Crambe, characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has a rosette growth form, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in late spring to early summer. Comarostaphylis arguta is well adapted to sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
